metadata.title: YouTube Sponsorship Guide 2025: Get Brand Deals as Creator
metadata.description: Land YouTube sponsorships. Negotiate deals and work with brands.

hero.headline: YouTube Sponsorship Guide
hero.subheadline: Land brand deals. Negotiate fair rates. Build partnerships.

sections.content: Sponsorships often pay more than ads, especially for smaller channels with engaged audiences. Brands want authentic integrations with creators their target audience trusts. Understanding how to pitch, price, and deliver helps you build sustainable sponsorship income.

sections.title: Landing Sponsorships
content: Create media kit with stats and demographics
Reach out to brands you genuinely use

sections.title: Sponsorship Best Practices
content: Only promote products you'd actually use
Negotiate based on average views, not subscribers
Build rate sheet as you gain experience

faq.question: When can I get sponsorships?
faq.answer: Technically any size—brands care about fit and engagement. Most sponsors want 10K+ subscribers minimum. Niche channels get sponsors earlier. Micro-influencers (10K-100K) often have better engagement rates.

faq.question: How much should I charge?
faq.answer: Common starting point: $20-50 per 1000 views (CPM). Dedicated videos worth more than integrations. Niche matters—finance, tech pay more. Always negotiate—first offer rarely best.

faq.question: How to find sponsors?
faq.answer: Join platforms: Grapevine, Aspire, CreatorIQ. Email brands you use directly. Media kit helps. As you grow, sponsors find you. Initial outreach is hustle but necessary.

faq.question: Should I take every sponsorship?
faq.answer: No—protect your audience trust. Reject products you don't believe in. Bad sponsorships hurt credibility and engagement. Better to decline than damage audience relationship. Long-term thinking wins.
